error.signature: Error: Resource already managed by Terraform: this resource is already in your state file
error.regex: (Resource .+ already managed|already in your state file|resource .+ already tracked|import .+ already managed)

verdict.summary: Attempted to import a resource that already exists in the Terraform state file.

dead_ends.action: Import the resource again with a different address
dead_ends.why_fails: This creates a duplicate state entry for the same cloud resource, causing conflicts on apply

dead_ends.action: Delete the state file and start fresh
dead_ends.why_fails: Deleting state makes Terraform unaware of all managed resources, potentially causing recreation of everything

workarounds.action: Check the state to confirm the resource is already tracked
workarounds.how: terraform state show RESOURCE_ADDRESS to verify the resource is already in state with correct attributes

workarounds.action: Use terraform state rm followed by re-import if the state entry is stale
workarounds.how: terraform state rm RESOURCE_ADDRESS to remove stale entry, then terraform import RESOURCE_ADDRESS RESOURCE_ID

leads_to.condition: After removing from state and re-importing, resource already exists in cloud

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Resource already exists means the cloud resource exists when Terraform tries to create it; already managed means the resource is already in the Terraform state
